channel.title: git on hg8's Notes
channel.description: Recent content in git on hg8's Notes

item.title: Bitlab - HackTheBox
item.description: Table of contents User flag. Recon Pivot www-data -> clave user Root Flag Recon Bitlab box was an interesting box, user part was typical real-life scenario (actually meet this scenario during multiple pentests) while the root part was my first time Reverse Engineering. Tl;Dr: The user was accesible First we add the box ip to our host file and let’s start!

item.title: Craft - HackTheBox
item.description: Table of contents Recon Remote code execution on API Pivot from docker container to user Recon Exploiting Vault for SSH root password Craft was a not so straight forward box, mainly based on little configuration mistakes rather than exploits. Which makes it more interesting in my opinion. I learned a few tricks on this one. First thing first, let’s add the box IP to the hosts file:
